TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PageQualitativeResolution extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the page resolution as a qualitative, non-numerical, value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this type as an alternative, or supplement, to stating resolution in dots per inch (dpi).
This enumeration is used to provide values for the <xref:System.Printing.PageResolution.QualitativeResolution%2A> property. The <xref:System.Printing.PageResolution> class, in turn, is used to provide values for the <xref:System.Printing.PrintCapabilities.PageResolutionCapability%2A> property where it specifies the various resolutions that a printer supports, and the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket.PageResolution%2A> property, where it instructs a printer what resolution to use.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution Default = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The default qualitative resolution for the printer.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution Draft = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Draft-level quality, which is 300 dpi for most printers.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution High = int32(3)

Docs.summary: High quality, which is 1200 dpi or greater for most printers.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution Normal = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Normal quality, which is 600 dpi for most printers.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution Other = int32(5)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Printing.PageQualitativeResolution Unknown = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The feature (whose options are represented by this enumeration) is set to an option not defined in the [Print Schema](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=186397).
